name: Apache ActiveMQ Artemis JMS Provider
description: Provides an embedded Artemis Broker.

service.ranking.name: Ranking
service.ranking.description: JMS providers are made available in the order of their service ranking. Higher rankings have precedence.

global.size.name: Global Size
global.size.description: Maximum amount of memory which message data may consume. Default: 500 MB.

max.disk.usage.name: Max Disk Usage
max.disk.usage.description: The max percentage of overall disk usage before the broker will block. The broker will perform scans on the disk to determine if the disk is beyond this configured limit. Once that limit is reached any message will be blocked.

persistence.enabled.name: Persistence Enabled
persistence.enabled.description: Indicates whether global persistence is enabled. When active, queue states are persisted at shutdown and queues can overflow to disk.

thread.pool.max.size.name: Thread Pool Max Size
thread.pool.max.size.description: Maximum number of threads to use for the thread pool. -1 means 'no limits'.

scheduled.thread.pool.max.size.name: Scheduled Thread Pool Max Size
scheduled.thread.pool.max.size.description: Maximum number of threads to use for the scheduled thread pool. -1 means 'no limits'.

graceful.shutdown.timeout.name: Graceful Shutdown Timeout
graceful.shutdown.timeout.description: Timeout (in milliseconds9 to wait for clients to disconnect before server shutdown.

queues.name: Queues
queues.description: Format: {name: 'myqueue', address: 'com.test.myqueue', durable: true, maxConsumers: 50, filter: 'color='red''}

addresses.max.delivery.attempts.name: Max Delivery Attempts
addresses.max.delivery.attempts.description: Defines how many time a cancelled message can be redelivered before sending to the dead-letter-address.

addresses.expiry.delay.name: Expiry Delay
addresses.expiry.delay.description: Defines the expiration time in ms that will be used for messages which are using the default expiration time (i.e. 0). For example, if expiry-delay is set to "10" and a message which is using the default expiration time (i.e. 0) arrives then its expiration time of "0" will be changed to "10." However, if a message which is using an expiration time of "20" arrives then its expiration time will remain unchanged. Setting expiry-delay to "-1" will disable this feature.

addresses.address.full.message.policy.name: Address Full Message Policy
addresses.address.full.message.policy.description: This attribute can have one of the following values: PAGE, DROP, FAIL or BLOCK and determines what happens when an address where max-size-bytes is specified becomes full. The default value is PAGE. If the value is PAGE then further messages will be paged to disk. If the value is DROP then further messages will be silently dropped. If the value is FAIL then further messages will be dropped and an exception will be thrown on the client-side. If the value is BLOCK then client message producers will block when they try and send further messages.

addresses.max.size.bytes.name: Address Max Size Bytes
addresses.max.size.bytes.description: What's the max memory an address could have before entering on page mode. Default: 30 MB

addresses.page.size.bytes.name: Page Size Bytes
addresses.page.size.bytes.description: The size of each page file used on the paging system. Only relevant when persistence is enabled.

addresses.page.cache.max.size.name: Page Cache Max Size
addresses.page.cache.max.size.description: The system will keep up to `page-max-cache-size` page files in memory to optimize IO during paging navigation. Only relevant when persistence is enabled.

cluster.user.name: Cluster User
cluster.user.description: When creating connections between nodes of a cluster to form a cluster connection, Apache ActiveMQ Artemis uses a cluster user and cluster password.

cluster.password.name: Cluster Password
cluster.password.description: When creating connections between nodes of a cluster to form a cluster connection, Apache ActiveMQ Artemis uses a cluster user and cluster password. Use the same user/pass between all cluster nodes. You must provide the encrypted password value. Note: the encrypted value is only decryptable on instances with the same master key.

cluster.call.timeout.name: Cluster Call  Timeout
cluster.call.timeout.description: When a packet is sent via a cluster connection and is a blocking call, i.e. for acknowledgements, this is how long it will wait (in milliseconds) for the reply before throwing an exception. For no timeout use -1

cluster.call.failover.timeout.name: Cluster Call Fail-Over Timeout
cluster.call.failover.timeout.description: Similar to call-timeout but used when a call is made during a fail-over attempt. For no timeout use -1

cluster.client.failure.check.period.name: Client Failure Check Period
cluster.client.failure.check.period.description: The period (in milliseconds) used to check if the cluster connection has failed to receive pings from another server.

cluster.notification.attempts.name: Cluster Notification Attempts
cluster.notification.attempts.description: How many times the cluster connection should broadcast itself when connecting to the cluster.

cluster.notification.interval.name: Cluster Notification Interval
cluster.notification.interval.description: How often (in milliseconds) the cluster connection should broadcast itself when attaching to the cluster.

id.cache.size.name: ID Cache Size
id.cache.size.description: The size of the cache for pre-creating message IDs. It should be no greater than the number of messages that can be squeezed into confirmation buffer (<confirmation-window-size/>)

cluster.confirmation.window.size.name: Cluster Confirmation Window Size
cluster.confirmation.window.size.description: The size (in bytes) of the window used for sending confirmations from the server connected to. So once the server has received confirmation-window-size bytes it notifies its client, A value of -1 means no window.

cluster.connection.ttl.name: Cluster Connection TTL
cluster.connection.ttl.description: This is how long a cluster connection should stay alive if it stops receiving messages from a specific node in the cluster.

cluster.duplicate.detection.name: Cluster Duplicate Detection
cluster.duplicate.detection.description: Internally cluster connections use bridges to link the nodes, and bridges can be configured to add a duplicate id property in each message that is forwarded. If the target node of the bridge crashes and then recovers, messages might be resent from the source node. By enabling duplicate detection any duplicate messages will be filtered out and ignored on receipt at the target node.

cluster.initial.connect.attempts.name: Cluster Initial Connect Attempts
cluster.initial.connect.attempts.description: The number of times the system will try to connect a node in the cluster initially. If the max-retry is achieved this node will be considered permanently down and the system will not route messages to this node.

cluster.max.retry.interval.name: Cluster Maximum Retry Interval
cluster.max.retry.interval.description: The maximum delay (in milliseconds) for retries.

cluster.min.large.message.size.name: Cluster Minimum Large Message Size
cluster.min.large.message.size.description: If the message size (in bytes) is larger than this value then it will be split into multiple segments when sent over the network to other cluster members.

cluster.producer.window.size.name: Cluster Producer Window Size
cluster.producer.window.size.description: The size for producer flow control over cluster connection. It's by default disabled through the cluster connection bridge but you may want to set a value if you are using really large messages in cluster. A value of -1 means no window.

cluster.reconnect.attempts.name: Cluster Reconnect Attempts
cluster.reconnect.attempts.description: The number of times the system will try to reconnect to a node in the cluster. If the max-retry is achieved this node will be considered permanently down and the system will stop routing messages to this node. Default is -1 (infinite retries).

cluster.retry.interval.name: Cluster Retry Interval
cluster.retry.interval.description: Internally, cluster connections cause bridges to be created between the nodes of the cluster. If the cluster connection is created and the target node has not been started, or say, is being rebooted, then the cluster connections from other nodes will retry connecting to the target until it comes back up, in the same way as a bridge does. This parameter determines the interval in milliseconds between retry attempts. It has the same meaning as the retry-interval on a bridge (as described in Core Bridges).

cluster.retry.interval.multiplier.name: Cluster Retry Interval Multiplier
cluster.retry.interval.multiplier.description: This is a multiplier used to increase the retry-interval after each reconnect attempt.

oauth.provider.ims.extended.details.urls.description: The list of URLs used to fetch additional data

oauth.provider.ims.validate.token.url.name: Validation URL
oauth.provider.ims.validate.token.url.description: The URL of the IMS API - validate token (e.g. <ENV>/ims/validate_token/v1)

oauth.provider.ims.session.property.name: Session Data Property
oauth.provider.ims.session.property.description: The name of the property that defines the session data url

ims.org.ref.name: Organization
ims.org.ref.description: IMS organization to sync from, in the form of <orgID> (with AdobeOrg as default auth source) or <orgID>@<authSrc> to specify the auth source as well. Optional, if not set will not sync groups.

ims.group.mapping.name: Group Mappings
ims.group.mapping.description: Mappings of IMS groups to local groups. Each entry is one group mapping, with the form: '<groupName>:<groupRole>=<localGroupID>', for example: 'Administrators:GRP_ADMIN=my-administrators'. Wildcards (* = all chars, ? = single char) are supported, for example: '*:GRP_ADMIN=my-administrators'. Requires organization (ims.org_ref) to be set.

oauth.provider.ims.only.license.group.name: Sync Only License Group
oauth.provider.ims.only.license.group.description: Sync Only The Group Member of the License Group

oauth.provider.ims.logout.name: Call IMS Logout
oauth.provider.ims.logout.description: Call IMS Logout API on AEM Logout event

name: Adobe Granite Access Token provider
description: Access Token provider

auth.token.provider.default.claims.name: Default JWT Claims
auth.token.provider.default.claims.description: Default JWT Claims in format: <claim-key>:<claim-value> (e.g. 'aud:"service.audience.com"'). Note: the string values must be provided in double quotes!

auth.access.token.request.name: Access Token Request URL
auth.access.token.request.description: Format to build the access token request URL against the configured end point. The '%s' in the format is replaced by the end point.

auth.token.provider.keypair.alias.name: KeyPair alias
auth.token.provider.keypair.alias.description: Alias to get the key pair from the user KeyStore

auth.token.provider.conn.timeout.name: Connection timeout
auth.token.provider.conn.timeout.description: The timeout until a connection is established to the authorization server in milliseconds

auth.token.provider.so.timeout.name: Socket timeout
auth.token.provider.so.timeout.description: The socket timeout which is the timeout for waiting for data from the authorization server in milliseconds

auth.token.provider.client.id.name: Client Id
auth.token.provider.client.id.description: Client Identifier for the authorization server

auth.token.provider.scope.name: Scope
auth.token.provider.scope.description: The scope passed as request parameter to the authorization server

auth.token.provider.reuse.access.token.name: Cache access tokens
auth.token.provider.reuse.access.token.description: If checked, the provider caches the access tokens as long as they are valid (based on expiration claim) and only obtain a new access token from the authorization server when invalid.

auth.token.provider.relaxed.ssl.name: Enable Relaxed SSL
auth.token.provider.relaxed.ssl.description: Enable Relaxed SSL (allow self signed certificates) for communication with a test authorization server. This configuration MUST BE DISABLED in production.

token.request.customizer.type.name: Name of token request customizer implementation
token.request.customizer.type.description: The name for referencing the token request customizer implementation to use. e.g. use 'default' to bind to services provided by the default implementation.

auth.token.validator.type.name: Token Validator Name
auth.token.validator.type.description: The name for referencing the token validator implementation to use. e.g. use 'default' to bind to services provided by the default implementation.

name: Adobe Granite Bearer Authentication Handler
description: Authentication handler for the "Bearer" HTTP Authentication Scheme. This authentication handler implements a solution to validate a provided bearer token against an OAuth Provider.This authentication handler requires configuration to be active.

path.name: Path
path.description: Repository path for which this authentication handler should be used by Sling. If this is empty, the authentication handler will be disabled. By default this is set to "/".

oauth.clientIds.allowed.name: Allowed OAuth client ids
oauth.clientIds.allowed.description: List of allowed OAuth client ids. If this is empty is not possible to authenticate using the Bearer Authentication Handler

auth.bearer.sync.ims.name: Synchronize user with the Provider
auth.bearer.sync.ims.description: If checked (default), then the crx user is synchronized with the Provider at each login

auth.tokenRequestParameter.name: Access Token Request Parameter
auth.tokenRequestParameter.description: The name of the request parameter property that is used if the authorization header is missing. If this property is empty, request parameter support is disabled (which is the default).

oauth.bearer.configid.name: Configuration ID Request Parameter
oauth.bearer.configid.description: The name of the request parameter property that is used for identifying the configuration.

oauth.jwt.support.name: JWT validation support
oauth.jwt.support.description: Use JWT (JSON Web Token) standard for validation (if available)

name: Default Token Validator
description: Default implementation of the token validator.

auth.token.validator.type.name: Token Validator Name
auth.token.validator.type.description: The name for referencing the token validator implementation to use. e.g. use 'default' to bind to services provided by the default implementation.

name: Adobe Granite OAuth Facebook Provider
description: Default Facebook OAuth Provider

name: Adobe Granite OAuth Github Provider
description: Default Github OAuth Provider

oauth.provider.github.authorization.url.name: Authorization Endpoint
oauth.provider.github.authorization.url.description: The URL of the Github Authorization Endpoint

oauth.provider.github.token.url.name: Token Endpoint
oauth.provider.github.token.url.description: The URL of the Github Token Endpoint

oauth.provider.github.profile.url.name: Profile Endpoint
oauth.provider.github.profile.url.description: The URL of the Github Profile Endpoint

name: Adobe Granite ProviderConfigManager Service
description: Private service for managing Provider, OAuthHelper, and ProviderConfig caches.

oauth.cookie.login.timeout.name: OAuth Cookie Max-Age Before Authorization
oauth.cookie.login.timeout.description: Max-Age for the encrypted cookie before authorization has completed; -1 indicates a session cookie (only valid for the current browser session).

oauth.cookie.max.age.name: OAuth Cookie Max-Age After Authorization
oauth.cookie.max.age.description: Max-Age for the encrypted cookie after authorization has succeeded; -1 indicates a session cookie (only valid for the current browser session)

name: Adobe Granite OAuth Authentication Handler
description: Authentication Handler for OAuth 1.0a and OAuth 2.0 (draft) providers. Currently only Twitter and Facebook are supported. In future versions of this Authentication Handler further providers will be supported. Note that this Authentication Handler is only enabled if configuration exists and the Path property is not set to an empty string.

path.name: Path
path.description: Repository path for which this authentication handler should be used by Sling. If this is empty, the authentication handler will be disabled. By default this is set to "/".

name: Adobe Granite OAuth Twitter Provider
description: Default Twitter OAuth Provider

name: Adobe Granite OAuth Application and Provider
description: Configures the OAuth Provider Application setup such that the Authentication Handler can authenticate users with the provider.

oauth.config.id.name: Config ID
oauth.config.id.description: OAuth Configuration IDs must be unique. This ID will be used to determine which config will be used for a particular oauth request with the "configid" request parameter.

oauth.client.id.name: Client ID
oauth.client.id.description: Application Client ID provided by the OAuth Provider. For OAuth 1.0a this is called the Consumer Key. This is required for the Authentication Handler to authenticate with OAuth for a specific Provider.

oauth.client.secret.name: Client Secret
oauth.client.secret.description: Application Client Secret provided by the OAuth Provider. For OAuth 1.0a this is called the Consumer Secret. This is required for the Authentication Handler to authenticate with OAuth for a specific Provider.

oauth.scope.name: Scope
oauth.scope.description: Scope for the authorization request to hand over to the provider

oauth.config.provider.id.name: Provider ID
oauth.config.provider.id.description: Assign the Provider ID used to match a ProviderConfig to a Provider

oauth.create.users.name: Create users
oauth.create.users.description: Whether to automatically create users if there is no matching CRX user for an OAuth authenticated users. By default this is not enabled. Handle with care.

oauth.userid.property.name: User ID Property
oauth.userid.property.description: The name of the property containing the user ID to use when automatically creating users. If this is left empty or invalid, user IDs will be generated in the format <provider prefix>-<external user id>.

force.strict.username.matching.name: Force Strict Username Matching
force.strict.username.matching.description: If enabled a strict username matching is applied, so two users are considered to be the same only and only if they have the same mapped OAuth username (and not only the same OAuthId property). By default this is not enabled. Handle with care.

oauth.encode.userids.name: Encode UserIds
oauth.encode.userids.description: Base.encode64 generated user ids for created users.

oauth.hash.userids.name: Hash UserIds
oauth.hash.userids.description: SHA-256 generated user ids for created users.

oauth.callBackUrl.name: Callback URL
oauth.callBackUrl.description: URL configured with the OAuth providers to redirect the client back. Use a relative url to use the host of the original request. Leave empty to use the originally requested URL instead. Suffix "/callback/j_security_check" is automatically appended to this url. Note: the domain for the callback must be registered at the provider side (e.g. Facebook or Twitter).

oauth.access.token.persist.name: Save access token
oauth.access.token.persist.description: Whether to save Oauth access token in users profile. If enabled, the token will be stored in encrypted form in the property specified by Provider.getAccessTokenPropertyPath().

oauth.access.token.persist.cookie.name: Save access token in the Cookies
oauth.access.token.persist.cookie.description: Whether to save Oauth access token in the cookies. If enabled, the token will be stored in encrypted form in the cookies (with the cookie name being the client Id)

oauth.csrf.state.protection.name: Enable Cross-Site Request Forgery state protection
oauth.csrf.state.protection.description: Enable the Cross-Site Request Forgery state protection as per http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-v2-31#section-10.12

oauth.redirect.request.params.name: Enable Persisting Request Params in Callback URL
oauth.redirect.request.params.description: Enabling Persisting of Original Request Parameters in the Callback URL formed during Authorization so that it can be used as a means to redirect the user to original resource on successful authentication

oauth.config.siblings.allow.name: Enable siblings configurations support
oauth.config.siblings.allow.description: Enabling siblings configurations support to allow other configurations for the Provider ID (oauth.config.provider.id) to be authenticated.

name: Adobe Granite Authentication Requirement and Login Path Handler
description: RequirementHandler implementation that updates the Sling authentication requirements (and the corresponding exclusion for the associated (optional) login paths).

supportedPaths.name: Supported Paths
supportedPaths.description: Paths under which authentication requirements will be respected by this handler. Leave this configuration unset if you want to add the 'granite:AuthenticationRequirement' mixin type to nodes without having them enforced (e.g. on author instances).

name: Adobe Granite SAML 2.0 Authentication Handler
description: Adobe Granite SAML 2.0 Authentication Handler

path.name: Path
path.description: Repository path for which this authentication handler should be used by Sling. If this is empty, the authentication handler will be disabled.

service.ranking.name: Service Ranking
service.ranking.description: OSGi Framework Service Ranking value to indicate the order in which to call this service. This is an int value where higher values designate higher precedence. Default value is 0.

idpUrl.name: IDP URL
idpUrl.description: URL of the IDP where the SAML Authentication Request should be sent to. If this property is empty the authentication handler is disabled.

idpCertAlias.name: IDP Certificate Alias
idpCertAlias.description: The alias of the IdP's certificate in the global truststore. If this property is empty the authentication handler is disabled.

idpHttpRedirect.name: IDP HTTP Redirect
idpHttpRedirect.description: Use an HTTP Redirect to the IDP URL instead of sending an AuthnRequest-message to request credentials. Use this for IDP initiated authentication.

serviceProviderEntityId.name: Service Provider Entity ID
serviceProviderEntityId.description: ID which uniquely identifies this service provider with the identity provider. If this property is empty the authentication handler is disabled.

assertionConsumerServiceURL.name: Assertion Consumer Service URL
assertionConsumerServiceURL.description: The (optional) AssertionConsumerServiceURL attribute of an Authn request specifies the location to which a <Response> message MUST be sent to the requester.

spPrivateKeyAlias.name: SP Private Key Alias
spPrivateKeyAlias.description: The alias of the SP's private key in the key-store of the 'authentication-service' system user. If this property is empty the handler will not be able to sign or decrypt messages.

keyStorePassword.name: Password of Key Store
keyStorePassword.description: The password of the key-store of the 'authentication-service' system user.

defaultRedirectUrl.name: Default Redirect
defaultRedirectUrl.description: The default location to redirect to after successful authentication.

userIDAttribute.name: UserID Attribute
userIDAttribute.description: The name of the attribute containing the user ID used to authenticate and create the user in the CRX repository. Leave empty to use the Subject:NameId.

useEncryption.name: Use Encryption
useEncryption.description: Whether or not this authentication handler expects encrypted SAML assertions. If this is enabled the SP's private key must be provided in the key-store of the 'authentication-service' system user (see SP Private Key Alias above).

createUser.name: Autocreate CRX Users
createUser.description: Whether or not to autocreate nonexisting users in the repository.

storeSAMLResponse.name: Store SAML Response
storeSAMLResponse.description: Whether or not to store the samlResponse value on the user node. This is ignored and samlResponse is always stored if handleLogout is enabled.

userIntermediatePath.name: Created User Intermediate Path
userIntermediatePath.description: When creating new users, this value will be used as the intermediate path.

addGroupMemberships.name: Add to Groups
addGroupMemberships.description: Whether or not a user should be automatically added to CRX groups after successful authentication.

groupMembershipAttribute.name: Group Membership
groupMembershipAttribute.description: The name of the attribute containing a list of CRX groups this user should be added to.

defaultGroups.name: Default Groups
defaultGroups.description: A list of default CRX groups users are added to after successful authentication.

nameIdFormat.name: NameIDPolicy Format
nameIdFormat.description: The value of the NameIDPolicy format parameter to send in the AuthnRequest message.

synchronizeAttributes.name: Synchronized Attributes
synchronizeAttributes.description: A list of attribute mappings (in the format "attributename=path/relative/to/user/node") which should be stored in the repository on user-synchronization.

handleLogout.name: Handle Logout
handleLogout.description: Whether or not logout (dropCredentials) requests will be processed by this handler.

logoutUrl.name: Logout URL
logoutUrl.description: URL of the IDP where the SAML Logout Request should be sent to. If this property is empty the authentication handler won't handle logouts.

clockTolerance.name: Clock Tolerance
clockTolerance.description: Time tolerance in seconds to compensate clock skew between IDP and SP when validating Assertions.

digestMethod.name: Digest Method
digestMethod.description: The digest algorithm to use when signing a SAML message.

signatureMethod.name: Signature Method
signatureMethod.description: The signature algorithm to use when signing a SAML message.

identitySyncType.name: Identity Sync Type
identitySyncType.description: Changes the synchronisation mechanism. This requires migration of the existing users, groups.

idpIdentifier.name: IDP Identifier
idpIdentifier.description: Identifier for IDP to ensure principal name uniqueness in the IDP context. If this property is empty, the 'Service Provider Entity ID' will be used instead.

name: Adobe Granite SSO Authentication Handler
description: Authentication Handler supporting single sign-on systems such as Siteminder or IIS NTLM. This handler just extracts the user ID from the HTTP Request and ignores any password information. The user ID can be extract from HTTP Request Headers, Cookies or Parameters.

path.name: Path
path.description: Repository path for which this authentication handler should be used by Sling. If this is empty, the authentication handler will be disabled.

service.ranking.name: Service Ranking
service.ranking.description: OSGi Framework Service Ranking value to indicate the order in which to call this service. This is an int value where higher values designate higher precedence. Default value is 0.

jaas.controlFlag.name: JAAS Control Flag
jaas.controlFlag.description: Property name specifying whether or not a LoginModule is REQUIRED, REQUISITE, SUFFICIENT or OPTIONAL. Refer to the JAAS configuration documentation for more details around the meaning of these flags. Jackrabbit Oak only.

jaas.realmName.name: JAAS Realm
jaas.realmName.description: Property name specifying the realm name (or application name) against which the LoginModule is be registered. If no realm name is provided then LoginModule is registered with a default realm as configured in the Felix JAAS configuration. Jackrabbit Oak only.

jaas.ranking.name: JAAS Ranking
jaas.ranking.description: Property name specifying the ranking (i.e. sort order) of the configured login module entries. The entries are sorted in a descending order (i.e. higher value ranked configurations come first). Jackrabbit Oak only.

headers.name: Header Names
headers.description: One or more HTTP Headers which might provide the user ID.

cookies.name: Cookie Names
cookies.description: One or more names of Cookies which might provide the user ID.

parameters.name: Parameter Names
parameters.description: One or more names of Request Parameters which might provide the user ID.

usermap.name: User Map
usermap.description: For selected users, the user name extracted from the HTTP request can be replaced with a different one in the credentials object. The mapping is defined here. If the user name "admin" appears on either side of the map, the mapping will be ignored . The character "=" has to be escaped with a leading "\".

format.name: Format
format.description: Indication of the format in which the user ID is provided. Use "Basic" if the user ID is encoded in the HTTP Basic Authentication format, "AsIs" if the user ID is provided in plain text or any regular expression applied value should be used as is or any regular expression.

trustedCredentialsAttribute.name: Trusted Credential Attribute
trustedCredentialsAttribute.description: The name of the attribute which is set with the user information in the trusted credentials. This needs to match the "trust_credentials_attribute" configuration of the default login module in Jackrabbit.However, this feature is deprecated and will no longer be supported in Jackrabbit Oak.

minimum.code.cache.size.name: Minimum code cache size
minimum.code.cache.size.description: Threshold for the code cache size, under which the health check will return a warning

name: Adobe Granite CRXDE Support Bundle Health Check
description: This health check checks if the crxde-support bundle is active.

name: Adobe Granite DavEx Health Check
description: This health check checks if the DavEx bundle is active or not

name: Adobe Granite Active Bundles Health Check
description: This health check scans the current set of OSGi bundles for inactive bundles.

ignored.bundles.name: Ignored Bundles
ignored.bundles.description: One or more Bundle Symbolic Names to be ignored.

max.queued.jobs.name: Maximum Number of Queued Jobs
max.queued.jobs.description: Threshold on the number of queued jobs that could exist at a certain moment

name: Adobe Granite Sling Get Servlet Health Check
description: Checks if the default Sling Get Servlet configuration follows the security guidelines.

name: Apache Sling Java Script Handler Health Check
description: Checks if the Sling Java Script Handler configuration follows the security guidelines.

name: Apache Sling Jsp Script Handler Health Check
description: Checks if the Sling Jsp Script Handler configuration follows the security guidelines.

name: Apache Sling Referrer Filter Health Check
description: Checks if the Sling Referrer Filter is configured in order to prevent CSRF attacks.

name: Adobe Granite WebDav Access Health Check
Component com.adobe.granite.comments.internal.CommentReplicationContentFilterFactory
description: Description for com.adobe.granite.comments.internal.CommentReplicationContentFilterFactory

replicate.comment.resourceTypes.name: Sling resource types
replicate.comment.resourceTypes.description: Comments collection sling resource types allowed for replication, add exact values

compatgroups.name: Compat Groups
compatgroups.description: Groups turned on for compat mode

id.name: Compat id
id.description: ID for a location to toggle compat mode (Compat Flag)

group.name: Compat Group
group.description: Group identifier for a group of compat ids

name: Adobe AEM Runtime-aware Resource Resolving Strategy
description: Resource resolving strategy which takes current runmode into account when resolving configurations.

enabled.name: Enabled
enabled.description: Enable this configuration resource resolving strategy.

fallbackPaths.name: Fallback paths
fallbackPaths.description: Global fallback configurations, ordered from most specific (checked first) to least specific.

name: Adobe Granite ContextHub
description: Description for com.adobe.granite.contexthub.impl.ContextHubImpl

com.adobe.granite.contexthub.silent_mode.name: Silent Mode
com.adobe.granite.contexthub.silent_mode.description: Silent mode - turn this option on to disable ContextHub's debug output.

com.adobe.granite.contexthub.show_ui.name: Show UI
com.adobe.granite.contexthub.show_ui.description: Indicates weather ContextHub's UI should be displayed.

name: Adobe Granite Cross-Origin Resource Sharing Policy
description: CORS policy as specified by its configuration.

alloworigin.name: Allowed Origins
alloworigin.description: List of allowed origins. Use * to allow any. Default is empty (allow none).

alloworiginregexp.name: Allowed Origins (Regexp)
alloworiginregexp.description: List of allowed regular expressions as origins. Example: 'http://.*\.example\.com' to allow all subdomains of example.com. To allow any origin, leave empty and set 'Allowed Origins' to *. Default is empty (allow none).

allowedpaths.name: Allowed paths
allowedpaths.description: Regular expressions of paths the filter applies. Default is .*

exposedheaders.name: Exposed Headers
exposedheaders.description: List of exposed headers. Default is empty (none).

maxage.name: Maximum Age
maxage.description: Number of seconds how long the results of a preflight request can be cached. A value of -1 indicates no caching. Default is 1800 (30min.).

supportedheaders.name: Supported Headers
supportedheaders.description: List of allowed headers. Use * to allow any. Default is (Origin, Accept, X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Access-Control-Request-Method and Access-Control-Request-Headers)

supportedmethods.name: Allowed Methods
supportedmethods.description: List of allowed methods. Default is (GET,HEAD,POST).

supportscredentials.name: Supports Credentials
supportscredentials.description: Indicates that the actual request can include user credentials. Default is true.

name: Adobe Granite CSRF Filter
description: Request filter checking the CSRF token of modification requests.

filter.methods.name: Filter Methods
filter.methods.description: These methods are checked by the filter.

filter.enable.safe.user.agents.name: Filter non-browser User Agents
filter.enable.safe.user.agents.description: If this setting is enabled, browser and not browser agents will be checked by the filter. If this setting is disabled, only browsers will be checked, non-browser clients will not be checked by the filter. The Safe User Agents will never be checked regardless of this setting.

filter.safe.user.agents.name: Safe User Agents
filter.safe.user.agents.description: These safe User Agents are not checked by the filter.

filter.excluded.paths.name: Excluded Paths
filter.excluded.paths.description: These paths are excluded by the filter. Each entry is of the form 'path'.

name: Adobe Granite CSRF Servlet
description: Servlet that return the CSRF token for a given user.

csrf.token.expires.in.name: CSRF Token Expires In
csrf.token.expires.in.description: The lifetime in seconds of the csrf token (min 600 seconds/10 minutes)

name: Adobe Granite Distribution - Encrypted Password Transport Secret Provider
description: Description for com.adobe.granite.distribution.core.impl.CryptoDistributionTransportSecretProvider

name: Adobe Granite Distribution - Diff Observer Factory
description: Description for com.adobe.granite.distribution.core.impl.diff.DiffChangesObserver

distributionDelay.name: diff distribution delay
distributionDelay.description: time (seconds) between detection of changes and triggering of distribution

name: Adobe Granite Distribution - Diff Event Listener
description: Description for com.adobe.granite.distribution.core.impl.diff.DiffEventListener

name: Adobe Granite Distribution - Distribution to Replication Event Transformer
description: Description for com.adobe.granite.distribution.core.impl.DistributionToReplicationEventTransformer

importer.name.name: Importer Names
importer.name.description: The list of importer names for which to enable the event transformer.

name: Component com.adobe.granite.distribution.core.impl.replication.adapters.ReplicationAgentProvider
description: Description for com.adobe.granite.distribution.core.impl.replication.adapters.ReplicationAgentProvider

forward.requests.name: Property forward.requests
forward.requests.description: Set this to true if the replication actions should be forwarded directly to distribution

name: Distribution Transport Handler
description: Executes a replication action by forwarding it to distribution system

forward.requests.name: Property forward.requests
forward.requests.description: Set this to true if the replication actions should be forwarded directly to distribution

name: Adobe Granite Distribution Transport Credentials - Access Token DistributionTransportSecretProvider
description: Description for com.adobe.granite.distribution.core.impl.transport.AccessTokenDistributionTransportSecretProvider

name.name: Name
name.description: The name of the secret provider.

userId.name: User id
userId.description: The identifier of the user which has access to the cryptographic material required to obtain access tokens

accessTokenProvider.target.name: Access Token Provider
accessTokenProvider.target.description: The target reference for the AccessTokenProvider used to obtain access tokens, e.g. use target=(name=...) to bind to services by name.

name: Adobe Granite HTTP Header Feature Flag
description: Displays the feature only for clients sending a special HTTP Header

feature.description.name: Description
feature.description.default: Displays\ the\ feature\ only\ for\ clients\ sending\ a\ special\ HTTP\ Header

http.header.name.name: HTTP Header Name
http.header.name.description: The HTTP Header name has to be sent from client

http.header.valuepattern.name: HTTP Header value pattern
http.header.valuepattern.description: The regexp pattern of HTTP Header value sent from client - see Java regular expression (http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/regex/Pattern.html)

name: Adobe Granite Random Feature Flag
description: Displays the feature only for a small percentage of users

feature.description.name: Description
feature.description.default: Displays\ the\ feature\ only\ for\ a\ small\ percentage\ of\ users

active.percentage.name: Active percentage
active.percentage.description: How often this flag returns true, randomly, in percent

cookie.name.name: Cookie name
cookie.name.description: The Cookie name where stored RandomFeature informations

name: Adobe Granite HTTP File Cache Store
description: File Cache Store

com.adobe.granite.httpcache.file.include.name: IncludeHost
com.adobe.granite.httpcache.file.include.description: Whether to include host name in document root

name: Adobe Granite HTTP Cache Filter
description: Cache Filter

name: Adobe Granite Pseudo Translations
description: Providing a pseudo locale "zz" with automated translations for testing. Wraps the string part with a prefix and suffix for the translation. Expects keys in the format: "string ((comment))".

pseudo.patterns.name: Patterns
pseudo.patterns.description: List of patterns for different countries within the "zz" language. Entries must have the form "<country> <pattern>" (space delimited), where country is a country code such as "zz" and pattern is the translation pattern which can use {string} for the original string and {comment} for the translation comment (optional)

name: Adobe Granite Preference Locale Resolver
description: This locale resolver reads the locale for a request from the current user's preference for the language.

security.preferences.name.name: Preference Name
security.preferences.name.description: Name of the preference the user's locale is stored. Be careful when changing this value as it affects the whole installation.

name: Granite System Information Collector
description: Collects in a Zipped stream all the system informations

name: Adobe Granite SSL Connector Factory
description: Factory for the SSL Connector

com.adobe.granite.jetty.ssl.port.name: HTTPS Port
com.adobe.granite.jetty.ssl.port.description: Port to listen on for HTTPS requests. Defaults to 8443.

com.adobe.granite.jetty.ssl.keystore.use.name: Keystore User
com.adobe.granite.jetty.ssl.keystore.use.description: The userID of the Keystore user

com.adobe.granite.jetty.ssl.ciphersuites.name: Excluded cipher suites
com.adobe.granite.jetty.ssl.ciphersuites.description: List of cipher suites that should be excluded. Default is none.

com.adobe.granite.jetty.ssl.ciphersuites.name: Included cipher suites
com.adobe.granite.jetty.ssl.ciphersuites.description: List of cipher suites that should be included. Default is none.

com.adobe.granite.jetty.ssl.client.certi.name: Client Certificate
com.adobe.granite.jetty.ssl.client.certi.description: Requirement for the Client to provide a valid certifcate. Defaults to none.

name: Adobe Granite Async Jobs Purge Scheduled Job
description: Schedule a background job for purging the async jobs which are older than threshold number of days

job.purge.threshold.name: Threshold number of days to delete jobs
job.purge.threshold.description: Number of days after which a job should be deleted

job.purge.max.jobs.name: Threshold number of maximum jobs to keep in history
job.purge.max.jobs.description: Number of jobs in job history after which extra jobs should be deleted

name: CommitStats Configuration
description: Configuration for CommitStats hook (Yes! This config can be updated at runtime without side-effects!) This is an Oak-level CommitHook that tracks some simple information about each commit. Every configured interval the CommitStats hook issues a log.info with statistics about commits in this period. The information tracked is composed of two parts: type and location (type:location). It is derived from three different sources:  1) org.slf4j.MDC.get(CommitStats.MDC_COMMIT_STATS_CONTEXT): when this is set, this defines the type:location info.  2) Thread.currentThread().getName() filtered by the configured threadNameMatchers that contain the resulting type:location  3) Thread.currentThread().getStackTrace() filtered by greedyStackMatchers first (and if that matches, it wins), or otherwise by the 4 stackFilters/stackMatchers/stackCategorizers/stackShorteners with which each stack element of the current stack is visited until there is a definite match ('stackFilters' first allows to filter anything uninteresting, 'stackMatchers' allows to directly match anything non-filtered, 'stackCategorizers' allows to categorize the next non-filtered stack element, and 'stackShorteners' finally allows to beautify that next non-filtered stack element to have it easier readable)

intervalSeconds.name: interval in seconds
intervalSeconds.description: interval in seconds after which a new info statement is logged (if there is anything to log).

commitsPerIntervalThreshold.name: commits per interval threshold
commitsPerIntervalThreshold.description: Number of commits per threshold that must be reached before logging at INFO, otherwise logging at DEBUG

maxLocationLength.name: maximum location length
maxLocationLength.description: maximum length of the location string tracked in statistics - if longer it is capped with '...'

maxDetailsShown.name: maximum num details shown
maxDetailsShown.description: maximum number of details shown in the statistics, the remainder is listed under 'others'

minDetailsPercentage.name: minimum details percentage
minDetailsPercentage.description: minimum percentage necessary to be listed, if lower it is listed under 'others'

threadMatchers.name: thread name matchers
threadMatchers.description: list of matcher=type:location which are matched against thread name. Matcher can be 'startsWith', 'wildcard' or 'regexp'. Type:Location can contain replace groups (eg '(1):(2)') when used with regexp.

maxGreedyDepth.name: maximum greedy depth
maxGreedyDepth.description: maximum number of stack elements inspected for greedyStackMatchers. This number helps avoiding scanning large stacks unnecessarily.

greedyStackMatchers.name: greedy stack element matchers
greedyStackMatchers.description: list of matcher=type:location which are matched against the stack part restricted by maxGreedyDepth. GreedyStackMatchers thus come before stackFilters/stackMatchers/stackCategorizers. Matcher can be 'startsWith', 'wildcard' or 'regexp'. Type:Location can contain replace groups (eg '(1):(2)') when used with regexp.

stackFilters.name: stack filters
stackFilters.description: list of matchers which will be filtered out during stack scanning.  Matcher can be 'startsWith', 'wildcard' or 'regexp'.

stackMatchers.name: stack matchers
stackMatchers.description: list of matcher=type:location which, when matching, will be treated as immediate match and action is evaluated (unlike stackCategorizers where the next stack elements are taken). Matcher can be 'startsWith', 'wildcard' or 'regexp'. Type:Location can contain replace groups (eg '(1):(2)') when used with regexp.

stackCategorizers.name: stack categorizers
stackCategorizers.description: list of matcher=type: which, when matching, will categorize the next non-filtered stack element  (unlike stackMatchers which directly identify the entire action string). Matcher can be 'startsWith', 'wildcard' or 'regexp'. Type (as in 'category') is a string followed with a colon ':'.

stackShorteners.name: stack shorteners
stackShorteners.description: list of matcher=:location that are applied after an earlier stack element matched with a stackCategorizer. Matcher can be 'startsWith', 'wildcard' or 'regexp'. Location can contain replace groups (eg ':(1)') when used with regexp.

name: Day Commons HTTP Client 3.1
description: Configuration for the Day Commons HTTP Client Wrapper

proxy.enabled.name: Enable HTTP Proxy
proxy.enabled.description: Whether to enable or disable HTTP Proxying globally. Setting this property to false disables HTTP Proxying and the other configurtion properties have no effect. The default value is false.

proxy.host.name: HTTP Proxy Host
proxy.host.description: Host name (or IP Address) and port of the HTTP Proxy. in the format host:port, e.g. proxy.corp.com:3128. This property is ignored if HTTP Proxying is disabled. This property does not have default value. Enabling HTTP Proxying but not setting the HTTP Proxy Host  causes HTTP Proxying to actually be disabled.

proxy.user.name: HTTP Proxy User
proxy.user.description: The name of the user to authenticate as with the HTTP Proxy Host. If this field is empty, the proxy is considered to not be authenticated. The default is empty. This property is ignored if proxying is disabled or the proxy host is not properly configured.

proxy.password.name: HTTP Proxy Password
proxy.password.description: The password of the HTTP Proxy user to authenticate with. The default is empty. This property is ignored if proxying is disabled or the proxy host is not properly configured.

proxy.ntlm.host.name: HTTP Proxy NTLM Host
proxy.ntlm.host.description: The host the authentication request is originating from.  Essentially, the computer name for this machine. By default the credentials assume simple username password authentication. If the proxy happens to be a Microsoft IIS Server using NTLM authentication this property must be set to the NT Domain name  of the user to authenticate as. This is not set by default.

proxy.ntlm.domain.name: HTTP Proxy NTLM Domain
proxy.ntlm.domain.description: The NTLM domain to authenticate within. By default the credentials assume simple username password authentication. If the proxy happens to be a Microsoft IIS Server using NTLM authentication this property must be set to the NT Domain name of the user to authenticate as. This is not set by default.

proxy.exceptions.name: No Proxy For
proxy.exceptions.description: Lists domain names, host names, IP Addresses or or network addresses for which the HTTP Proxy Host should not be used. A domain name indicating all hosts of a domain is indicated by a leading dot, e.g. ".day.com". A network address is indicated with subnet mask notation indicating the number of bits make up the network address, e.g 192.168.1.0/24 means the class C network "192.168.1". Note that for proxy selection, the host name of URL is not resolved but directly compared to the list of exceptions. For this reason you might want to indicate both the network address and the domain for targets which should not be passed through the proxy. This property has no effect if HTTP Proxying is  disabled. The default value is [ localhost, 127.0.0.1 ].

name: Adobe Granite Closed User Group (CUG) Support
description: Configures the support for Closed User Groups. Please note, that Closed User Group configuration must be available for Closed User Group support to be available at all. In addition, existing Closed User Group configuration may still disable Closed User Groups by setting the "Enable CUG Roots" property to false. This may for example be used to preserve the list of exempted principals while still (temporarily) disable support for Closed User Groups.

cug.exempted.principals.name: CUG Exempted Principals
cug.exempted.principals.description: List of Principals for which any CUG restrictions do not apply.

cug.enabled.name: Enable CUG Roots
cug.enabled.description: Whether or not CUG roots are enabled on a global level or not. If this flag is not set (the default), CUG roots are not enabled.

cug.principals.regex.name: Regular expression
cug.principals.regex.description: The regular expression to which the principle name is to be matched while creating ACEs.

cug.principals.replacement.name: Replacement
cug.principals.replacement.description: The string to be substituted for each match

name: Adobe Granite Login Selector Authentication Handler
description: Selects a login form based on a mapping configuration.

path.name: Path
path.description: Repository path for which this authentication handler should be used by Sling. If this is empty, the authentication handler will be disabled.

service.ranking.name: Service Ranking
service.ranking.description: OSGi Framework Service Ranking value to indicate the order in which to call this service. This is an int value where higher values designate higher precendence. Default value is 5000.

auth.loginselector.mappings.name: Login Page Mappings
auth.loginselector.mappings.description: Maps login pages to content trees. The format is <login-page-path>:<content-tree>, e.g. /content/mysite/login:/content/mysite. Any mappings defined here are overriden by any Login Page Mappings Configuration via a content page (see below).

auth.loginselector.changepw.mappings.name: Change Password Page Mappings
auth.loginselector.changepw.mappings.description: Maps change password pages to content trees. The format is <login-page-path>:<content-tree>, e.g. /content/mysite/login:/content/mysite.

auth.loginselector.defaultloginpage.name: Default Login Page
auth.loginselector.defaultloginpage.description: If no mappings are defined, nor no mapping matches the request, this is the default login page being redirected to. This can be overridden in the content page configuration.

auth.loginselector.defaultchangepwpage.name: Default Change Password Page
auth.loginselector.defaultchangepwpage.description: If no mappings are defined, nor no mapping matches the request, this is the default change password page being redirected to.

auth.loginselector.handle.name: Path Info
auth.loginselector.handle.description: A list of request extensions indicating requests for which the Login Selector Authentication Handler may request credentials. Any request whose extension is not one the listed extensions will not cause the credentials to be requested. If this list is empty the default list of html and htm is used. Note that the list entries must not have leading dots. Requests without extension or requests with trailing slashes (/) are always handled by the Login Selector Authentication Handler regardless of this configuration.

auth.loginselector.handle.all.extensions.name: Handle all Extensions
auth.loginselector.handle.all.extensions.description: If enabled, the Login Selector Handler will request credentials for all extensions, regardless of the above configuration.

name: Day CQ Link Externalizer
description: Creates absolute URLs

externalizer.domains.name: Domains
externalizer.domains.description: List of domain mappings. In the form: "name [scheme://]domain.com[:port][/contextpath]". Standard required names are "publish" (public website DNS, such as "http://www.mysite.com"), "author" (author DNS, such as "https://author.mysite.com") and "local" (this instance directly). The scheme will be used as default scheme (if not specified by the code) and can globally define whether http or https is desired. The context path must match the installation of the sling launchpad webapp on that instance. Additional custom domains can be added, each with a unique name.

externalizer.host.name: Host name
externalizer.host.description: Deprecated - use "local" under domains instead and keep this property empty. - Host and port of the server as adressed from the outside, e.g. "server.com" or "server.com:8080".

externalizer.contextpath.name: Context path
externalizer.contextpath.description: Deprecated - use "local" under domains instead and keep this property empty. - Context path under which the CQ/Sling launchpad webapp is running, e.g. "/contextpath".

externalizer.encodedpath.name: Assume encoded path
externalizer.encodedpath.description: If active, Externalizer assumes that resource paths passed to its methods are URL-encoded. This might be necessary if your resource paths potentially contain "?" and/or "#" (which would be considered to start the query string/the fragment of the URL otherwise). Note that activating this setting may cause issues with other parts of the application that assume non-encoded paths if affected resource paths contain characters that need to be URL-encoded.

xmp.filter.apply_whitelist.name: Apply Whitelist to XMP Properties
xmp.filter.apply_whitelist.description: Only let the whitelisted xmp properties through, applied before any blacklist

xmp.filter.whitelist.name: Whitelisted XML Names for XMP filtering
xmp.filter.whitelist.description: XML Names, such as '{namespace-uri}name', '{namespace-uri}*', 'prefix:name' and 'prefix:*', passed on during XMP filtering. Use '[>n]' or '[<n]' to limit the values accepted for multi-valued XMP properties. Example: 'history[<100]' will only let the first 99 values through

xmp.filter.apply_blacklist.name: Apply Blacklist to XMP Properties
xmp.filter.apply_blacklist.description: Filter out the blacklisted xmp properties, applied after any whitelisting

xmp.filter.blacklist.name: Blacklisted XML Names for XMP filtering
xmp.filter.blacklist.description: XML Names, such as '{namespace-uri}name', '{namespace-uri}*', 'prefix:name' and 'prefix:*', filtered out during XMP processing. Use '[>n]' or '[<n]' to limit the values removed for multi-valued XMP properties. Example: 'history[>100]' discards the 101st and following values.

This may cause the creation of JCR Nodes at configured entry paths.

name: Day CQ Cluster Based Start Level Controller
description: Controls the OSGi Framework start level based on whether the bound repository is the Cluster Master or Slave repository.

cluster.level.enable.name: Enable
cluster.level.enable.description: Whether to enable or not the start level controller. Default is "true". If the start level controller is disabled the OSGi Framework start level is not changed by this component.

cluster.master.level.name: Master Start Level
cluster.master.level.description: The start level to switch the framework to if the bound repository is the Cluster Master node. Default is "30".

cluster.slave.level.name: Master Start Level
cluster.slave.level.description: The start level to switch the framework to if the bound repository is the Cluster Slave node. Default is "15". If this value is less than the providing bundle's current start level, the start level of the bundle is changed to this configured value to ensure the bundle remains started after swichting the start level. In addition, it is suggested to set the OSGi framework initial startlevel to this same startlevel. This can be accomplished by setting the "org.osgi.framework.startlevel.beginning" in the sling.properties file to this value.

repcache.ttl.description: The time (in seconds) report data gets cached.

repcache.max.description: Maximum number of reports to be cached. Choose a low number if your reports contains lots of data to avoid out of memory situations.

description: Configures the reporting framework.

repconf.timezone.name: Timezone
repconf.timezone.description: Use a timezone ID such as 'America/Los_Angeles' or 'Europe/Zurich' that is used for calculating dates and times. If left empty, the server's default timezone will be used.

repconf.locale.name: Locale
repconf.locale.description: Use a locale ID such as 'en', 'en_US', 'de' or 'de_CH' to specify the locale to be used for reporting.

repconf.snapshots.description: Repository path where snapshot data is saved.

repconf.repdir.description: Repository path where reports are located.

repconf.hourofday.name: Daily snapshots
repconf.hourofday.description: Hour of day (0 - 23; local server time) daily snapshots will be taken.

repconf.minofhour.name: Hourly snapshots
repconf.minofhour.description: Minute of hour (0 - 59) hourly snapshots will be taken.

repconf.maxrows.name: Rows (max)
repconf.maxrows.description: Maximum number of rows to be included in a snapshot; set to 0 to include all rows

repconf.fakedata.name: Fake data
repconf.fakedata.description: Allows the creation of fake historic data (testing purposes only; note that activating this feature might impose security issues!)

repconf.snapshotuser.name: Snapshot user
repconf.snapshotuser.description: An optional user ID for taking snapshot. Basically, snapshots are taken for the user that has finsihed the report. There might be situations (for example on a publish system) where you might want specify a fallback user that is used instead. Note that specifying a user might impose a security risk.

repconf.enforcesnapshotuser.name: Enforce snapshot user
repconf.enforcesnapshotuser.description: Check if snapshots should always be taken for the user specified above. Note that this might have serious security impacts if not handled correctly.

service.bad_link_tolerance_interval.description: The number of hours after which a repeatedly unsuccessfully checked link is considered a bad link.

service.check_override_patterns.description: Space-separated list of Java regular expression patterns for links that should not be checked by the link checker, but must be a valid uri anyways.

service.cache_broken_internal_links.name: Cache Broken Internal Links
service.cache_broken_internal_links.description: Enable caching of broken internal links. This option will improve performance of pages with many broken links that point within the same site.

service.special_link_prefix.name: Special Link Prefixes
service.special_link_prefix.description: Prefixes that specify a special link that is not checked or rewritten at all.

service.special_link_patterns.name: Special Link Patterns

scheduler.period.description: The time ( in seconds ) between background runs of the link checker.

User-Agent.description: User Agent is required in Http HEAD request for some domain

good_link_test_interval.description: The interval in hours to check good links.

bad_link_test_interval.name: Bad Link Test Interval
bad_link_test_interval.description: The interval in hours to check bad links.

connection.timeout.description: The time ( in milliseconds ) for connection to disconnect.

name: Day CQ Link Checker Transformer
description: This is the linkchecker transformer which handles each page request. By default it rewrites links and checks them.

linkcheckertransformer.disableRewriting.name: Disable Rewriting
linkcheckertransformer.disableRewriting.description: Completly disable all rewriting of links.

linkcheckertransformer.disableChecking.name: Disable Checking
linkcheckertransformer.disableChecking.description: Completly disable all link checking. All links are handled as valid.

linkcheckertransformer.mapCacheSize.name: Map Cache Size
linkcheckertransformer.mapCacheSize.description: The cache for the map operations. A value of less than 50 disables the cache.

linkcheckertransformer.strictExtensionCh.name: Strict Extension Check
linkcheckertransformer.strictExtensionCh.description: If checked, a strict extension check is performed to detect HTML pages. By default the extension can occur at any location in the path and can be followed by a suffix. With strict checking, the extension has to be the last element in the path. Only for links to HTML pages the mapping configuration is used.

linkcheckertransformer.stripHtmltExtensi.name: Strip HTML Extension
linkcheckertransformer.stripHtmltExtensi.description: If checked, all links with a .html or .htm extension are rewritten and their extension is removed.

linkcheckertransformer.rewriteElements.name: Rewrite Elements
linkcheckertransformer.rewriteElements.description: List of html elements and their attributes which are rewritten. Pleasse add each entry in the form {elementName}:{attributeName}.

linkcheckertransformer.stripExtensionPat.name: Blacklisted paths
linkcheckertransformer.stripExtensionPat.description: Add paths for which stripping of extension is NOT to be performed

description: Link Checker repository Storage.

service.max_links_per_host.description: Maximum number of links for each host to be kept in the repository for validation.

service.save_external_link_references.name: Save external link references
service.save_external_link_references.description: If checked, the urls referencing external links will be saved in the repository.

cache.entry.lifetime.description: How long (in seconds) to keep facets in the cache. Set to zero to disable automatic expiration.

Turning this off will loose ability to leverage the search index and leads to more filtering on the querybuilder for such queries.

versionpurge.minVersions.description: The minimum number of versions to keep. If this value is set to a value less than 1 no minimum number of versions is retained.

replace.pattern.name: Replace pattern
replace.pattern.description: The pattern that replaces the matches found. You may use regex group references like $1, $2. Additionally, this pattern supports keywords like {designPath} which get resolved with the actual value during import.

name: Adobe Granite HTTP Header Authentication Handler
description: Implements the authorization steps based on the Authorization header of the HTTP request. This authenticator supports the BASIC authentication method.

path.name: Path
path.description: Repository path for which this authentication handler should be used by Sling. If this is empty, the authentication handler will be disabled.

auth.http.nologin.name: Disable Login Page
auth.http.nologin.description: Check this if the Login Page of this authenticator should be disabled or not. If not checked, the loing page is returned if a request to a page triggers the login mechanism. If this is checked, the login page is only returned if explicitly requested (for example by the login servlet at "/bin/login.html"). In author systems, this property is generally not checked, while on publish systems this property is checked to prevent presenting casual users with the login form.

auth.http.realm.name: HTTP Realm
auth.http.realm.description: Name of the HTTP realm - this name is displayed in the login window to the user (and is a key for the client to cache the credentials).

auth.default.loginpage.name: Default Login Page
auth.default.loginpage.description: Absolute path of the page to use to display the default login form. This page is rendered if no Closed User Group applies or the applicable Closed User Group does not declare its own login page. This property is used to render the page as is in an HTTP GET request. As such the value must included any necessary request extension such as ".html". The default value of this property is "/login", which is a vanity URL.

auth.cred.form.name: Login Form Clients
auth.cred.form.description: Lists identifiers of clients which are known to support form based HTTP (Basic) authentication. Such authentication presents a form and uses AJAX requests to validate the user name and password and assumes the client caches this information. This is only known to work in Firefox and some Internet Explorer browsers. The default value for this property therefore is [ "Firefox", "Shiretoko", "MSIE 7", "MSIE 6" ]. Changing this value is strongly discouraged because it may prevent login. All browsers not supporting form based HTTP (Basic) authentication will use regular HTTP (Basic) authentication using the 401/UNAUTHORIZED status code and the regular browser password dialog.

auth.cred.utf8.name: UTF-8 Credentials
auth.cred.utf8.description: Lists identifiers of clients which are known to encode non-ASCII credentials using UTF-8 character encoding. Clients whose User-Agent header does not contain one of the listed identifiers are assumed to encode the credentials using ISO-8859-1 character encoding. The default list of clients is [ "Firefox", "Shiretoko", "Chrome", "Opera", "curl", "Wget" ].

name: Adobe Page Impressions Tracker
description: Adobe Page Impressions configuration component.

description: Redirect page request to target locations

excluded.resource.types.name: Excluded resource types

name: Adobe CQ Foundation SaferSlingPostValidator
description: The SaferSlingPostValidator checks POST requests for safety and recommends to REJECT or ACCEPT based on safe/unsafe constructs in the request.

parameter.whitelist.name: Parameter Name Whitelist
parameter.whitelist.description: Properties with : in them are often security significant, by default they are not allowed through, with certain 'safe' values white listed. Properties starting with : in them are automatically white listed.

parameter.whitelist.prefixes.name: Parameter Name Prefix Whitelist
parameter.whitelist.prefixes.description: This configuration allows white listing certain parameter name prefixes which are known to be safe.

binary.parameter.whitelist.name: Binary Parameter Whitelist
binary.parameter.whitelist.description: Binary properties with '.' in them can trigger mime type guessing from the 'extension' part when served by the DefaultGetServlet.

modifier.whitelist.name: Modifier Whitelist
modifier.whitelist.description: Some '@' suffixes allow bypassing security otherwise provided by the Dispatcher. Only white listed suffixes are allowed.

operation.whitelist.name: Operation Whitelist
operation.whitelist.description: The SlingPostServlet supports some powerful :operation values such as import/export. So only the basic safe operations are allowed.

operation.whitelist.prefixes.name: Operation Prefix Whitelist
operation.whitelist.prefixes.description: Only specific operations given a specific name prefix are allowed.

typehint.whitelist.name: TypeHint Whitelist
typehint.whitelist.description: A subset of node types known to be safe.

resourcetype.whitelist.name: ResourceType Whitelist
resourcetype.whitelist.description: All resource type settings, except those that hav been whitelisted. Candidates on the whitelist should be strongly vetted for XSS, CSRF and any other security vulnerabilities.

name: Adobe Granite Token Authentication Handler
description: Implements the authorization steps based on the token authorization.

path.name: Path
path.description: Repository path for which this authentication handler should be used by Sling. If this is empty, the authentication handler will be disabled.

token.required.attr.name: Required Attributes
token.required.attr.description: Which request properties to use as required attributes for authentication. Default (no value set) is "Client IP Address".

token.alternate.url.name: Alternate Authentication Url
token.alternate.url.description: Alternate url for the user name and password submission by the form. This name is can be used in addition to the 'j_security_check' to avoid any conflict with Application Server's security.

token.encapsulated.name: Enable encapsulated token support
token.encapsulated.description: By enabling this feature the token verification is achieved offline (without repository access)

skip.token.refresh.name: Skip Login Token Refresh
skip.token.refresh.description: Skip login token refresh for requests going to any of the URIs in this list

token.samesite.cookie.attr.name: SameSite attribute for the login-token cookie
token.samesite.cookie.attr.description: Value for the login-token's SameSite attribute. Default (no value set) is "Lax".

useragents.samesite.exempt.attr.name: User agents to be exempted from samesite attribute
useragents.samesite.exempt.attr.description: Some clients are incompatible with the samesite attribute. Specify the user agent regexes to be exempted when samesite = "None". This setting has no effect when samesite is not None.

name: Adobe Granite Token Authentication Handler: Cleanup Task
description: Task to regularly purge expired tokens from the repository

enable.token.cleanup.task.name: Enable Token Cleanup Task
enable.token.cleanup.task.description: By enabling this feature the Token Cleanup Task is executed according to the configured schedule. By default the switch is off, in favour of the more effective Oak Token Cleanup

scheduler.expression.name: Schedule
scheduler.expression.description: Cron expression scheudling this job. Default is hourly 17m23s after the hour. See http://www.docjar.com/docs/api/org/quartz/CronTrigger.html for a description of the format for this value.

batch.size.name: Batch Size
batch.size.description: Number of nodes to be deleted at once

id: Event handler for changes to Media Portal Cloud Configuration
name: Media Portal Replication HTTP Client
description: HTTP Client used to communicate with Media Portal

connectionTimeout.name: Connection timeout
connectionTimeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds until a connection is established. A timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout. Default is 180000ms

socketTimeout.name: Socket timeout
socketTimeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds for waiting for data or a maximum period of inactivity between two consecutive data packets. Default is 600000ms

name: Apache Felix Event Admin Implementation
description: Configuration for the Apache Felix Event Admin Implementation. This configuration overwrites configuration defined in framework properties of the same names.

org.apache.felix.eventadmin.ThreadPoolSi.name: Thread Pool Size
org.apache.felix.eventadmin.ThreadPoolSi.description: The size of the thread pool used for event delivery. The default value is 20. Increase in case of a large amount of events. A value of less then 2 triggers the default value. If the pool is exhausted, event delivery is blocked until a thread becomes available from the pool. Each event is delivered in a thread from the pool unless the ignore timeouts is configured for the receiving event handler.

org.apache.felix.eventadmin.AsyncToSyncT.name: Async/sync Thread Pool Ratio
org.apache.felix.eventadmin.AsyncToSyncT.description: The ratio of asynchronous to synchronous threads in the internal thread pool. Ratio must be positive and may be adjusted to represent the distribution of post to send operations.  Applications with higher number of post operations should have a higher ratio.

org.apache.felix.eventadmin.Timeout.name: Timeout
org.apache.felix.eventadmin.Timeout.description: The black-listing timeout in milliseconds. The default value is 5000. Increase or decrease at own discretion. A value of less then 100 turns timeouts off. Any other value is the time in milliseconds granted to each event handler before it gets blacklisted

org.apache.felix.eventadmin.RequireTopic.name: Require Topic
org.apache.felix.eventadmin.RequireTopic.description: Are event handlers required to be registered with a topic? This is enabled by default. The specification says that event handlers must register with a list of topics they are interested in. Disabling this setting will enable that handlers without a topic are receiving all events (i.e., they are treated the same as with a topic=*).

org.apache.felix.eventadmin.IgnoreTimeou.name: Ignore Timeouts
org.apache.felix.eventadmin.IgnoreTimeou.description: Configure event handlers to be called without a timeout. If a timeout is configured by default all event handlers are called using the timeout. For performance optimization it is possible to configure event handlers where the timeout handling is not used - this reduces the thread usage from the thread pools as the timout handling requires an additional thread to call the event handler. However, the application should work without this configuration property. It is a pure optimization! The value is a list of strings. If a string ends with a dot, all handlers in exactly this package are ignored. If the string ends with a star, all handlers in this package and all subpackages are ignored. If the string neither ends with a dot nor with a star, this is assumed to define an exact class name.

org.apache.felix.eventadmin.IgnoreTopic.name: Ignore Topics
org.apache.felix.eventadmin.IgnoreTopic.description: For performance optimization it is possible to configure topics which are ignored by the event admin implementation. In this case, a event is not delivered to registered event handlers. The value is a list of strings (separated by comma). If a single value ends with a dot, all topics in exactly this package are ignored. If a single value ends with a star, all topics in this package and all sub packages are ignored. If a single value neither ends with a dot nor with a start, this is assumed to define an exact topic. A single star can be used to disable delivery completely.

name: Apache Felix Jetty Based Http Service
description: Configuration for the embedded Jetty Servlet Container.

org.apache.felix.http.host.name: Host Name
org.apache.felix.http.host.description: IP Address or Host Name of the interface to which HTTP and HTTPS bind. The default is "0.0.0.0" indicating all interfaces.

org.apache.felix.http.enable.name: Enable HTTP
org.apache.felix.http.enable.description: Whether or not HTTP is enabled. Defaults to true thus HTTP enabled.

org.osgi.service.http.port.name: HTTP Port
org.osgi.service.http.port.description: Port to listen on for HTTP requests. Defaults to 8080.

org.apache.felix.http.timeout.name: Connection Timeout
org.apache.felix.http.timeout.description: Time limit for reaching an timeout specified in milliseconds. This property applies to both HTTP and HTTP connections. Defaults to 60 seconds.

org.apache.felix.https.enable.name: Enable HTTPS
org.apache.felix.https.enable.description: Whether or not HTTPS is enabled. Defaults to false thus HTTPS disabled.

org.osgi.service.http.port.secure.name: HTTPS Port
org.osgi.service.http.port.secure.description: Port to listen on for HTTPS requests. Defaults to 443.

org.apache.felix.https.keystore.name: Keystore
org.apache.felix.https.keystore.description: Absolute Path to the Keystore to use for HTTPS. Only used if HTTPS is enabled in which case this property is required.

org.apache.felix.https.keystore.password.name: Keystore Password
org.apache.felix.https.keystore.password.description: Password to access the Keystore. Only used if HTTPS is enabled.

org.apache.felix.https.keystore.key.pass.name: Key Password
org.apache.felix.https.keystore.key.pass.description: Password to unlock the secret key from the Keystore. Only used if HTTPS is enabled.

org.apache.felix.https.truststore.name: Truststore
org.apache.felix.https.truststore.description: Absolute Path to the Truststore to use for HTTPS. Only used if HTTPS is enabled.

org.apache.felix.https.truststore.passwo.name: Truststore Password
org.apache.felix.https.truststore.passwo.description: Password to access the Truststore. Only used if HTTPS is enabled.

org.apache.felix.https.clientcertificate.name: Client Certificate
org.apache.felix.https.clientcertificate.description: Requirement for the Client to provide a valid certificate. Defaults to none.

org.apache.felix.http.context_path.name: Context Path
org.apache.felix.http.context_path.description: The Servlet Context Path to use for the Http Service. If this property is not configured it defaults to "/". This must be a valid path starting with a slash and not ending with a slash (unless it is the root context).

org.apache.felix.http.mbeans.name: Register MBeans
org.apache.felix.http.mbeans.description: Whether or not to use register JMX MBeans from the servlet container (Jetty). If this is enabled Jetty Request and Connector statistics are also added. The default is to not enable JMX.

org.apache.felix.jetty.statisticshandler.name: Enable Statistics
org.apache.felix.jetty.statisticshandler.description: Whether or not to use enable Statistics in the servlet container (Jetty).

org.apache.felix.http.session.timeout.name: Session Timeout
org.apache.felix.http.session.timeout.description: Default lifetime of an HTTP session specified in a whole number of minutes. If the timeout is 0 or less, sessions will by default never timeout. The default is 0.

org.apache.felix.http.jetty.threadpool.m.name: Thread Pool Max
org.apache.felix.http.jetty.threadpool.m.description: Maximum number of jetty threads. Using the default -1 uses Jetty's default (200).

org.apache.felix.http.jetty.acceptors.name: Acceptors
org.apache.felix.http.jetty.acceptors.description: Number of acceptor threads to use, or -1 for a default value. Acceptors accept new TCP/IP connections. If 0, then the selector threads are used to accept connections.

org.apache.felix.http.jetty.selectors.name: Selectors
org.apache.felix.http.jetty.selectors.description: Number of selector threads, or <=0 for a default value. Selectors notice and schedule established connection that can make IO progress.

org.apache.felix.http.jetty.headerBuffer.name: Header Buffer Size
org.apache.felix.http.jetty.headerBuffer.description: Size of the buffer for request and response headers. Default is 16KB.

org.apache.felix.http.jetty.requestBuffe.name: Request Buffer Size
org.apache.felix.http.jetty.requestBuffe.description: Size of the buffer for requests not fitting the header buffer. Default is 8KB.

org.apache.felix.http.jetty.responseBuff.name: Response Buffer Size
org.apache.felix.http.jetty.responseBuff.description: Size of the buffer for responses. Default is 24KB.

org.apache.felix.http.jetty.maxFormSize.name: Maximum Form Size
org.apache.felix.http.jetty.maxFormSize.description: Size of Body for submitted form content. Default is 200KB.

org.apache.felix.http.path_exclusions.name: Path Exclusions
org.apache.felix.http.path_exclusions.description: Contains a list of context path prefixes. If a Web Application Bundle is started with a context path matching any of these prefixes, it will not be deployed in the servlet container.

org.apache.felix.https.jetty.ciphersuite.name: Excluded Cipher Suites
org.apache.felix.https.jetty.ciphersuite.description: List of cipher suites that should be excluded. Default is none.
